conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine collision timing.
Car A starts at 25 m/s and decelerates; Car B starts at 15 m/s and decelerates.
Calculate distance covered by Car A using area under graph.
Calculate distance covered by Car B using area under graph.
Collision occurs when distance between cars becomes zero.
Use relative motion equation: s_A = s_B + d.
At t = 20 seconds, both cars have certain velocities.
Car A covers more distance relative to Car B after 20 seconds.
Collision occurs before 20 seconds due to relative deceleration rates.
The two cars collide before 20 seconds of braking.
